trans-unit.source: Create a NoSQL DocumentDB database | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create a NoSQL DocumentDB database | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create managed databases using the online service portal for Azure DocumentDB, a NoSQL document database for JSON. Get a free trial today.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create managed databases using the online service portal for Azure DocumentDB, a NoSQL document database for JSON. Get a free trial today.

trans-unit.source: To use Microsoft Azure DocumentDB, you must have a <linkText>DocumentDB account</linkText><title></title>, a database, a collection, and documents.
trans-unit.target: To use Microsoft Azure DocumentDB, you must have a <linkText>DocumentDB account</linkText><title></title>, a database, a collection, and documents.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to create a DocumentDB database in the Microsoft Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to create a DocumentDB database in the Microsoft Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: Databases do not have to be created using the preview portal, you can also create them using the <linkText>DocumentDB SDKs</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Databases do not have to be created using the preview portal, you can also create them using the <linkText>DocumentDB SDKs</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For a C# code sample showing how to create a database using the DocumentDB .NET SDK, see the <linkText>Program.cs</linkText><title></title> file in the DatabaseManagement project, available in the <linkText>azure-documentdb-net</linkText><title></title> repository on <linkText>GitHub.com</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a C# code sample showing how to create a database using the DocumentDB .NET SDK, see the <linkText>Program.cs</linkText><title></title> file in the DatabaseManagement project, available in the <linkText>azure-documentdb-net</linkText><title></title> repository on <linkText>GitHub.com</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure preview portal, click Browse all.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure preview portal, click Browse all.

trans-unit.source: In the Browse blade, click DocumentDB Accounts.
trans-unit.target: In the Browse blade, click DocumentDB Accounts.

trans-unit.source: In the DocumentDB Accounts blade, select the account in which to add a DocumentDB database.
trans-unit.target: In the DocumentDB Accounts blade, select the account in which to add a DocumentDB database.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have any accounts listed, you'll need to <linkText>create a DocumentDB account</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have any accounts listed, you'll need to <linkText>create a DocumentDB account</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot highlighting the Browse button, DocumentDB Accounts on the Browse blade, and a DocumentDB account on the DocumentDB Accounts blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot highlighting the Browse button, DocumentDB Accounts on the Browse blade, and a DocumentDB account on the DocumentDB Accounts blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the DocumentDB Account blade, click Add Database.
trans-unit.target: In the DocumentDB Account blade, click Add Database.

trans-unit.source: In the Add Database blade, enter the ID for your new database.
trans-unit.target: In the Add Database blade, enter the ID for your new database.

trans-unit.source: When the name is validated, a green check mark appears in the ID box.
trans-unit.target: When the name is validated, a green check mark appears in the ID box.

trans-unit.source: Click OK at the bottom of the screen to create the new database.
trans-unit.target: Click OK at the bottom of the screen to create the new database.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot highlighting the Add Database button on the DocumentDB Account blade, the ID box on the Add Database blade, and the OK button</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot highlighting the Add Database button on the DocumentDB Account blade, the ID box on the Add Database blade, and the OK button</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The new database now appears in the Databases lens on the DocumentDB Account blade.
trans-unit.target: The new database now appears in the Databases lens on the DocumentDB Account blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the new database in the DocumentDB Account blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the new database in the DocumentDB Account blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now that you have a DocumentDB database, the next step is to <linkText>create a collection</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have a DocumentDB database, the next step is to <linkText>create a collection</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Once your collection is created, you can <linkText>add documents</linkText><title></title> by using the Document Explorer in the preview portal, <linkText>import documents</linkText><title></title> into the collection by using the DocumentDB Data Migration Tool, or use one of the <linkText>DocumentDB SDKs</linkText><title></title> to perform CRUD operations.
trans-unit.target: Once your collection is created, you can <linkText>add documents</linkText><title></title> by using the Document Explorer in the preview portal, <linkText>import documents</linkText><title></title> into the collection by using the DocumentDB Data Migration Tool, or use one of the <linkText>DocumentDB SDKs</linkText><title></title> to perform CRUD operations.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB has .NET, Java, Python, Node.js, and JavaScript API SDKs.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB has .NET, Java, Python, Node.js, and JavaScript API SDKs.

trans-unit.source: For .NET code samples showing how to create, remove, update and delete documents, see <linkText>Program.cs</linkText><title></title> in the DocumentManagement project in the azure-documentdb-net repository on GitHub.com.
trans-unit.target: For .NET code samples showing how to create, remove, update and delete documents, see <linkText>Program.cs</linkText><title></title> in the DocumentManagement project in the azure-documentdb-net repository on GitHub.com.

trans-unit.source: After you have documents in a collection, you can use <linkText>DocumentDB SQL</linkText><title></title> to <linkText>execute queries</linkText><title></title> against your documents by using the <linkText>Query Explorer</linkText><title></title> in the preview portal, the <linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title>, or one of the <linkText>SDKs</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: After you have documents in a collection, you can use <linkText>DocumentDB SQL</linkText><title></title> to <linkText>execute queries</linkText><title></title> against your documents by using the <linkText>Query Explorer</linkText><title></title> in the preview portal, the <linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title>, or one of the <linkText>SDKs</linkText><title></title>.
